title: Barclays looks overseas for new boss
text:
Welcome to your preview of The Times Subscribe now Barclays looks overseas for new boss Antony Jenkins was fired as chief executive after nearly three years in the job Justin Tallis/AFP/Getty Images 1 of 1 Antony Jenkins was fired as chief executive after nearly three years in the job Justin Tallis/AFP/Getty Images Katherine Griffiths Banking Editor Published 39 minutes ago 
Barclays expects to have a list of candidates for chief executive by the end of the summer and the winner is likely to be a foreigner. 
John McFarlane, Barclays’ executive chairman, said that abroad seemed “more fertile ground” than the UK, but added that several internal candidates were being considered as a replacement for Antony Jenkins, who was fired three weeks ago. Spencer Stuart have been hired as headhunters. 
Tushar Morzaria, Barclays’ finance director, is regarded as one candidate. He refused to rule himself out yesterday but said that he was focused on his present role. 
Barclays’s shares rose 2 Subscribe now
